docs.title: DevOps Boilerplates & Quick Reference
docs.text: Welcome to the comprehensive, searchable documentation for DevOps templates, boilerplates, and quick reference guides. This repository contains production-ready templates for Terraform, Kubernetes, Docker Compose, Ansible, and more.

docs.title: Quick Start
docs.text:
Get started in under 3 minutes:

Install CLIBrowse DocsGenerate Template Bash
# Clone the repository
git clone https://github.com/mlorentedev/boilerplates.git
cd boilerplates

# Install the bp CLI
make install-cli

# Search for templates
bp search "spring boot"
Bash
# Start local documentation server
make docs-serve

# Open in browser
open http://localhost:8000
Bash
# Generate a new Spring Boot microservice
bp new spring-boot-api my-service

# Generate Terraform infrastructure
bp new terraform-aws my-infra

docs.title: About
docs.text: This repository is a personal collection of templates and boilerplates used for DevOps and software development projects. It includes configurations for various tools and frameworks that are frequently used in production environments.

docs.title: Purpose
docs.text: The goal is to provide quick-start templates that follow best practices and can be adapted for specific use cases. All templates are tested and maintained regularly.

docs.title: Contents
docs.text:
• Terraform: Infrastructure as Code for AWS, Azure, DigitalOcean, and more
  • Kubernetes: Production-ready manifests for platform services
  • Docker Compose: Complete stacks for development and production
  • Ansible: Automation playbooks for server management
  • GitHub Actions: CI/CD workflows
  • Microservices: Spring Boot and Quarkus templates

docs.title: Quick Start
docs.text:
Bash
# Create inventory
cat > inventory.ini <<EOF
[servers]
server1 ansible_host=192.168.1.10
server2 ansible_host=192.168.1.11
EOF

# Run playbook
ansible-playbook -i inventory.ini playbook.yml

# Check syntax
ansible-playbook --syntax-check playbook.yml

# Dry run
ansible-playbook --check -i inventory.ini playbook.yml

docs.title: Docker Cheatsheet
docs.text: Quick reference for Docker commands and operations.

docs.title: Container Management
Image Management
docs.text:
Bash
# List images
docker images
docker image ls

# Pull/push images
docker pull <image>:<tag>
docker push <image>:<tag>

# Build images
docker build -t <name>:<tag> .
docker build -f Dockerfile.prod -t <name>:<tag> .

# Remove images
docker rmi <image>
docker image prune          # Remove dangling images
docker image prune -a      # Remove all unused images

docs.title: Docker Compose
docs.text:
Bash
# Start services
docker-compose up
docker-compose up -d        # Detached mode
docker-compose up --build   # Rebuild images

# Stop services
docker-compose stop
docker-compose down
docker-compose down -v      # Remove volumes

# View logs
docker-compose logs
docker-compose logs -f <service>

# Execute commands
docker-compose exec <service> /bin/bash

# Scale services
docker-compose up -d --scale <service>=3

docs.title: Network Management
Volume Management
System Management
docs.text:
Bash
# System info
docker info
docker version

# Disk usage
docker system df

# Clean up
docker system prune         # Remove unused data
docker system prune -a     # Remove all unused data
docker system prune --volumes  # Include volumes

# Resource usage

docker stats <container>

docs.title: Dockerfile Best Practices
docs.text:
Docker
# Multi-stage build
FROM node:16 AS build
WORKDIR /app
COPY package*.json ./
RUN npm install
COPY . .
RUN npm run build

FROM node:16-alpine
WORKDIR /app
COPY --from=build /app/dist ./dist
COPY package*.json ./
RUN npm install --production
CMD ["node", "dist/index.js"]

docs.title: CLI Usage Guide

docs.title: Installation

docs.title: Global Options
docs.text:
Bash
bp [global options] <command> [command options] [arguments...]
Option Description --version, -v Show version information --help, -h Show help --verbose Enable verbose output --quiet, -q Suppress output --config <file> Use custom config file --no-color Disable colored output

docs.title: search
docs.text:
Search through all documentation and snippets.

Bash
bp search [options] <query>

Options:

Option Description --category, -c <cat> Filter by category (terraform, k8s, docker, ansible) --tag, -t <tag> Filter by tag --limit, -l <n> Limit results to n items (default: 20) --lang <lang> Search language (en, es) --recent Search recent history --history Show search history --multi Multi-select mode

Examples:

Bash
# Basic search
bp search "kubernetes ingress"

# Category filtered search
bp search -c k8s "ingress"

# Tag filtered search
bp search -t monitoring "prometheus"

# Limit results
bp search -l 5 "docker"

# Interactive search with fzf
bp search

# Search with preview
bp search "terraform" --preview

docs.title: find
docs.text:
Search within a specific category.

Bash
bp find <category> [options] <query>

Categories: - terraform or tf - kubernetes or k8s - docker or dk - ansible or ans - github-actions or gh

Examples:

Bash
# Find in Terraform
bp find terraform "aws vpc"
bp find tf "eks cluster"

# Find in Kubernetes
bp find kubernetes "ingress"
bp find k8s "deployment"

# Find in Docker
bp find docker "compose postgres"
bp find dk "network"

# Find in Ansible
bp find ansible "ubuntu setup"
bp find ans "docker install"

docs.title: show
docs.text:
Display documentation for a specific template.

Bash
bp show [options] <template>

Options:

Option Description --raw Show raw markdown --preview Show preview only --copy Copy content to clipboard

Examples:

Bash
# Show template documentation
bp show spring-boot-api

# Show with raw markdown
bp show --raw kubernetes-deployment

# Preview template
bp show --preview terraform-aws-vpc

# Show and copy to clipboard
bp show --copy docker-compose-postgres

docs.title: list
docs.text:
List all available templates.

Bash
bp list [options] [category]

Options:

Option Description --category, -c <cat> Filter by category --tag, -t <tag> Filter by tag --format, -f <fmt> Output format (table, json, yaml) --tree Show as tree structure

Examples:

Bash
# List all templates
bp list

# List by category
bp list terraform
bp list -c k8s

# List by tag
bp list -t database

# Output as JSON
bp list -f json

# Show as tree
bp list --tree

docs.title: new
docs.text:
Generate a new project from a template.

Bash
bp new [options] <template> <name>

Options:

Option Description --output, -o <dir> Output directory (default: current) --vars, -v <file> Variables file (YAML/JSON) --interactive, -i Interactive mode (prompts for variables) --dry-run Show what would be generated --force, -f Overwrite existing files

Examples:

Bash
# Generate Spring Boot microservice
bp new spring-boot-api my-service

# Generate with custom output directory
bp new -o ./projects spring-boot-api my-service

# Generate with variables file
bp new -v vars.yaml terraform-aws-vpc my-vpc

# Interactive mode
bp new -i kubernetes-deployment my-app

# Dry run
bp new --dry-run spring-boot-api my-service

# Force overwrite
bp new -f spring-boot-api my-service

docs.title: copy
docs.text:
Copy a snippet to clipboard.

Bash
bp copy [options] <snippet>

Options:

Option Description --preview Preview before copying --edit Edit before copying --format, -f <fmt> Output format (raw, json, yaml)

Examples:

Bash
# Copy snippet
bp copy docker-compose-postgres

# Preview before copying
bp copy --preview kubernetes-deployment

# Edit before copying
bp copy --edit terraform-vpc

# Copy as JSON
bp copy -f json spring-boot-config

docs.title: web
docs.text:
Open documentation in web browser.

Bash
bp web [options] [page]

Options:

Option Description --port, -p <port> Server port (default: 8000) --no-open Don't open browser --build Build before serving

Examples:

Bash
# Open documentation
bp web

# Open specific page
bp web terraform/aws

# Use custom port
bp web -p 8080

# Build and serve
bp web --build

# Start server without opening browser
bp web --no-open

docs.title: cheatsheet
docs.text:
Generate a cheatsheet for a topic.

Bash
bp cheatsheet [options] <topic>

Options:

Option Description --format, -f <fmt> Output format (pdf, png, md, html) --output, -o <file> Output file --style, -s <style> Style theme (light, dark) --size, -z <size> Page size (a4, letter, a5)

Examples:

Bash
# Generate Docker cheatsheet
bp cheatsheet docker

# Generate as PDF
bp cheatsheet -f pdf kubernetes

# Custom output file
bp cheatsheet -o k8s-cheat.pdf kubernetes

# Dark theme
bp cheatsheet -s dark docker

# Letter size
bp cheatsheet -z letter terraform

docs.title: recent
docs.text:
Show recently used templates and searches.

Bash
bp recent [options] [n]

Options:

Option Description --limit, -l <n> Show last n items (default: 10) --type, -t <type> Filter by type (search, template, all) --clear Clear recent history

Examples:

Bash
# Show recent items
bp recent

# Show last 5 items
bp recent 5
bp recent -l 5

# Show only recent searches
bp recent -t search

# Show only recent templates
bp recent -t template

# Use most recent template
bp recent 1

# Clear history
bp recent --clear

docs.title: favorite
docs.text:
Manage favorite templates.

Bash
bp favorite <action> [template]

Actions: - add <template> - Add to favorites - remove <template> - Remove from favorites - list - List all favorites - use <template> <name> - Use favorite to create project

Examples:

Bash
# Add to favorites
bp favorite add spring-boot-api

# Remove from favorites
bp favorite remove spring-boot-api

# List favorites
bp favorite list

# Use favorite
bp favorite use spring-boot-api my-service

docs.title: cache
docs.text:
Manage search cache and index.

Bash
bp cache <action>

Actions: - clear - Clear cache - rebuild - Rebuild search index - stats - Show cache statistics - clean - Remove old cache files

Examples:

Bash
# Clear cache
bp cache clear

# Rebuild search index
bp cache rebuild

# Show statistics
bp cache stats

# Clean old files
bp cache clean

docs.title: config
docs.text:
Manage configuration.

Bash
bp config <action> [key] [value]

Actions: - get <key> - Get configuration value - set <key> <value> - Set configuration value - list - List all configuration - reset - Reset to defaults - edit - Open config file in editor

Examples:

Bash
# Get configuration
bp config get editor

# Set configuration
bp config set editor "code"

# List all configuration
bp config list

# Reset to defaults
bp config reset

# Edit config file
bp config edit

docs.title: completion
docs.text:
Generate shell completion script.

Bash
bp completion <shell>

Supported shells: - bash - zsh - fish - powershell

Examples:

Bash
# Generate Bash completion
bp completion bash > /etc/bash_completion.d/bp

# Generate Zsh completion
bp completion zsh > /usr/local/share/zsh/site-functions/_bp

# Generate Fish completion
bp completion fish > ~/.config/fish/completions/bp.fish

# Generate PowerShell completion
bp completion powershell > $PROFILE

docs.title: update
docs.text:
Update bp CLI and templates.

Bash
bp update [options]

Options:

Option Description --check Check for updates without installing --version <ver> Update to specific version --templates Update only templates --cli Update only CLI

Examples:

Bash

# Check for updates
bp update --check

# Update to specific version
bp update --version v1.5.0

# Update only templates
bp update --templates

# Update only CLI
bp update --cli

docs.title: version
docs.text:
Show version information.

Bash
bp version [options]

Options:

Option Description --check Check for newer version --verbose, -v Show detailed version info

Examples:

Bash
# Show version
bp version

# Check for updates
bp version --check

# Show detailed version info
bp version -v

docs.title: Config File Location
docs.text:
The configuration file is located at:

  • Linux/macOS: ~/.config/bp/config.yaml
  • Windows: %APPDATA%\bp\config.yaml

docs.title: Config File Format
docs.text:
YAML
# Default editor for 'bp config edit' and 'bp copy --edit'
editor: vim

# Default output directory for 'bp new'
output_dir: ./

# Enable colored output
color: true

# Search settings
search:
  limit: 20
  category: all
  fuzzy: true

# Cache settings
cache:
  enabled: true
  ttl: 3600  # 1 hour

# Web server settings
web:
  port: 8000
  auto_open: true

# Favorites
favorites:
  - spring-boot-api
  - terraform-aws-vpc
  - kubernetes-deployment

# Recent limit
recent_limit: 10

docs.title: Environment Variables
docs.text: Variable Description BP_CONFIG Custom config file path BP_CACHE_DIR Custom cache directory BP_EDITOR Default editor BP_OUTPUT_DIR Default output directory BP_NO_COLOR Disable colored output

docs.title: 1. Deploy Microservice to Kubernetes
docs.text:
Bash
# Search for Spring Boot template
bp search "spring boot"

# Generate project
bp new spring-boot-api user-service

# Build and test
cd user-service
./mvnw clean package

# Find Kubernetes deployment template
bp find k8s "deployment"

# Generate Kubernetes manifests
bp new k8s-deployment user-service

# Deploy
kubectl apply -f k8s/

docs.title: 2. Setup Infrastructure with Terraform
docs.text:
Bash
# List Terraform templates
bp list terraform

# Show AWS VPC template
bp show terraform-aws-vpc

# Generate infrastructure
bp new -i terraform-aws-vpc my-infrastructure

# Deploy
cd my-infrastructure
terraform init
terraform plan
terraform apply

docs.title: 3. Create Development Environment
docs.text:
Bash
# Find Docker Compose stack
bp find docker "dev stack"

# Generate stack
bp new docker-compose-dev dev-env

# Start services
cd dev-env
docker-compose up -d

# Check status
docker-compose ps

make docs-serve

bp web

docs.title: 4. Search Documentation
docs.text:
Use the search bar (Ctrl+K or Cmd+K) to find anything instantly:

  • Type partial words: k8s ing finds Kubernetes Ingress
  • Use categories: terraform aws finds AWS Terraform templates
  • Search commands: docker ps finds Docker commands
  • Find snippets: postgres finds PostgreSQL configurations

docs.title: Deploy a Microservice to Kubernetes
docs.text:
Bash
# 1. Generate Spring Boot microservice
bp new spring-boot-api user-service

# 2. Build Docker image
cd user-service
docker build -t user-service:latest .

# 3. Generate Kubernetes manifests
bp new k8s-deployment user-service

# 4. Deploy to Kubernetes
kubectl apply -f k8s/

docs.title: Setup Infrastructure with Terraform
docs.text:
Bash
# 1. Generate Terraform AWS infrastructure
bp new terraform-aws my-infrastructure

# 2. Configure variables
cd my-infrastructure
cp terraform.tfvars.example terraform.tfvars
# Edit terraform.tfvars with your values

# 3. Deploy infrastructure
terraform init
terraform plan
terraform apply

docs.title: Setup Development Environment
docs.text:
Bash
# 1. Generate Docker Compose stack
bp new docker-compose-dev dev-stack

# 2. Start services
cd dev-stack
docker-compose up -d

# 3. Check services
docker-compose ps

# Services available:
# - PostgreSQL: localhost:5432
# - Redis: localhost:6379
# - PgAdmin: localhost:8080

docs.title: Automate Server Setup with Ansible
docs.text:
Bash
# 1. Configure inventory
cat > inventory.ini <<EOF
[servers]
server1 ansible_host=192.168.1.10
server2 ansible_host=192.168.1.11
EOF

# 2. Copy SSH key
bp copy ansible-ssh-key > add-ssh-key.yml

# 3. Run playbook
ansible-playbook -i inventory.ini add-ssh-key.yml

docs.title: Search Tips & Tricks
docs.text: Master the search functionality to find anything in < 3 seconds.

docs.title: Keyboard Shortcuts
docs.text: Shortcut Action Ctrl+K or Cmd+K Open search Esc Close search Up / Down Navigate results Enter Go to result Ctrl+N / Ctrl+P Next/previous result

docs.title: CLI Search
docs.text:
Bash
# Basic search
bp search "kubernetes ingress"

# Search with category filter
bp find terraform "aws vpc"

# Interactive search (uses fzf)
bp search

# Search recent history
bp search --recent

docs.title: Basic Search
docs.text:
Simple text search finds partial matches:

Text Only
kubernetes        # Finds all Kubernetes content
docker compose    # Finds Docker Compose content
spring boot       # Finds Spring Boot templates

docs.title: Exact Phrases
docs.text:
Use quotes for exact matches:

Text Only
"kubectl apply"        # Exact phrase
"docker-compose up"    # Exact command

docs.title: Boolean Operators
docs.text:
Combine search terms:

Text Only
kubernetes AND ingress     # Must contain both
terraform OR ansible       # Contains either
docker NOT compose        # Contains docker but not compose

docs.title: Wildcards
docs.text:
Use wildcards for flexible matching:

Text Only
kube*         # kubernetes, kubectl, etc.
*sql          # postgresql, mysql, etc.
spring-*-api  # spring-boot-api, spring-cloud-api, etc.

docs.title: Category Filters
docs.text:
Prefix search with category:

Text Only
terraform:aws       # Only AWS Terraform templates
k8s:ingress        # Only Kubernetes ingress
ansible:ubuntu     # Only Ubuntu Ansible playbooks
docker:postgres    # Only PostgreSQL Docker configs

docs.title: Fuzzy Finder (fzf)
docs.text:
Interactive search with preview:

Bash
# Launch interactive search
bp search

# Or with initial query
bp search "kubernetes"

# Navigation:
# - Type to filter
# - Ctrl+N/P for next/previous
# - Enter to select
# - Ctrl+C to cancel

docs.title: Preview Panel
docs.text: The fzf interface shows: - Template name and category - Description - Related files - Quick preview of content

docs.title: Multi-Select
docs.text:
Select multiple results:

Bash
# Enable multi-select
bp search --multi

# Navigation:
# - Tab to select/deselect
# - Enter to confirm
# - Ctrl+A to select all

docs.title: Shell Integration
docs.text:
Add to your shell config for instant access:

Bash
# Bash/Zsh: Add to ~/.bashrc or ~/.zshrc
function bps() {
    local result=$(bp search "$@")
    if [ -n "$result" ]; then
        echo "$result"
        echo "$result" | pbcopy  # macOS
        # or: xclip -selection clipboard  # Linux
    fi
}

# Usage
bps "docker postgres"  # Search and copy to clipboard

docs.title: VS Code Integration
docs.text:
1. Install extension: mlorentedev.boilerplates-snippets

docs.title: Alfred/Ulauncher Integration
docs.text:
Create custom workflow:

Bash
# Alfred Workflow
keyword: bp {query}
script: /usr/local/bin/bp search "{query}"

# Ulauncher Extension
pip install ulauncher-boilerplates

docs.title: 1. Use Shortcuts
docs.text:
Instead of full commands:

Bash
alias bps='bp search'
alias bpf='bp find'
alias bpc='bp copy'

docs.title: 2. Remember Common Searches
docs.text:
Create aliases for frequent searches:

Bash
alias bpk8s='bp find kubernetes'
alias bptf='bp find terraform'
alias bpdk='bp find docker'

docs.title: 3. Use Tab Completion
docs.text:
Bash
bp search ku[TAB]       # Completes to kubernetes
bp find ter[TAB]        # Completes to terraform

docs.title: 4. Leverage Recent
docs.text:
Bash
bp recent    # Show recent searches
bp recent 1  # Use most recent

docs.title: 5. Use Favorites
docs.text:
Bash
bp favorite add "kubernetes ingress"
bp favorite use ingress  # Quick access

docs.title: No Results Found
docs.text:
Bash
# Check spelling
bp search "kubernets"  # Wrong
bp search "kubernetes"  # Correct

# Use fuzzy search
bp search "k8s"  # Works

# Try broader terms
bp search "ingress"  # Instead of "nginx-ingress-controller"

docs.title: Slow Search
docs.text:
Bash
# Rebuild index
bp cache rebuild

# Reduce scope
bp find kubernetes "ingress"  # Instead of bp search "ingress"

# Limit results
bp search --limit 10 "docker"

docs.title: Wrong Results
docs.text:
Bash
# Use exact phrases
bp search '"kubectl apply"'  # Exact match

# Use category filter
bp find terraform "apply"  # Only Terraform content

# Use tags
bp search --tag k8s "apply"  # Only K8s content

docs.title: Prerequisites
docs.text:
Bash
# Install kubectl
curl -LO "https://dl.k8s.io/release/$(curl -L -s https://dl.k8s.io/release/stable.txt)/bin/linux/amd64/kubectl"

docs.title: Applying Templates
docs.text:
Bash

docs.text:

apiVersion: v1
kind: Pod
metadata:
  name: secure-pod
spec:
  securityContext:
    runAsNonRoot: true
    runAsUser: 1000
    fsGroup: 1000
  containers:
    - name: app
      image: myapp:latest
      securityContext:
        allowPrivilegeEscalation: false
        capabilities:
          drop:
            - ALL
        readOnlyRootFilesystem: true

docs.title: Prerequisites
docs.text:
Bash
# Install Terraform
# Ubuntu/Debian
sudo apt-get update
sudo apt-get install terraform

# macOS
brew install terraform

# Verify installation
terraform --version

docs.title: Basic Usage
docs.text:
Bash
# Navigate to template directory
cd terraform/aws

# Initialize Terraform
terraform init

# Review planned changes
terraform plan

# Apply changes
terraform apply

# Destroy resources
terraform destroy

docs.title: Configuration
docs.text:
Create a terraform.tfvars file with your variables:

Terraform
# terraform.tfvars
region = "us-east-1"
environment = "production"
project_name = "my-project"

docs.title: State Management
docs.text:
Always use remote state for production:

Terraform
terraform {
  backend "s3" {
    bucket = "my-terraform-state"
    key    = "prod/terraform.tfstate"
    region = "us-east-1"
    encrypt = true
    dynamodb_table = "terraform-locks"
  }
}

docs.title: Variable Management
docs.text:
Use variable files for different environments:

Bash
# Development
terraform apply -var-file="dev.tfvars"

# Production
terraform apply -var-file="prod.tfvars"

docs.text:
Text Only
terraform/
├── modules/
│   ├── vpc/
│   ├── eks/
│   └── rds/
├── environments/
│   ├── dev/

docs.title: Common Commands
docs.text:
Bash

terraform fmt -recursive

# Validate configuration
terraform validate

# Show current state
terraform show

# List resources
terraform state list

# Import existing resource
terraform import aws_instance.example i-1234567890abcdef0

# Refresh state
terraform refresh

terraform output

terraform apply

# Save logs to file

docs.title: Security Considerations
docs.text:
• Never commit sensitive data to version control
  • Use encrypted remote state
  • Implement least privilege IAM policies
  • Enable MFA for destructive operations
  • Use Terraform Cloud for team collaboration
  • Regular security audits with tools like checkov
Bash
# Security scan
checkov -d .

# Terraform plan with security checks
tfsec .
